page.title: 03BEXLEYHEATH TRANSPORT (road)
page.content: Communications have been very important to the growth and development of Bexleyheath. As a result of its position, Bexleyheath has had trackways through it since the time of the Ancient Britons. The modern Watling Street, is part of the Roman Road built from London to Dover. This road passed through Bexleyheath to the south of the present Broadway. The Broadway is the main east-west route through Bexleyheath. With the new Shopping Complex, there are plans to pedestrianise the central section of the Broadway. Northern and Southern relief roads will be built to take traffic around the Broadway. Public opinions about the changes have been mixed. However, most people would like to see an improved bus link between the Shopping Complex and the railway station, a mile away.
